thing.dna.phenotyper

Class C_MapLocPhenotyper

  • java.lang.Object
    • thing.dna.phenotyper.C_MapLocPhenotyper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    C_EucaryotePhenotyper

    public class C_MapLocPhenotyper
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a link between a (mapped)DNA and the traits expressed by the creature possessing the DNA. The phenotyper knows which map locations correspond to which traits. It currently has no info on dominance, epistasis, etc.

    Actual trait values are determined by specialized callbacks (objects) which are passed in when trait map locs are specified. To express a trait, the phenotyper is given the DNA and the trait in question. It then uses that trait's special "TraitExpressor" to determine the trait's value.

    Note that the same DNA could have multiple MapLocPhenotypers, each tailored to a particular hypothesis about how an organism's DNA is expressed.

    Author:
    kyle wagner, elyk@acm.org, version 1.0, aug 28, 2002 / adapted J.Le Fur 02.2011, rev. JLF 08.2014
